item.description: categories: - "" - "" date: “2017-10-31T22:42:51-05:00” description: Example data from IBM for data analysis of HR image: pic07.jpg keywords: "" slug: blog5 title: "" — library(tidyverse) #load libraries ## -- Attaching packages --------------------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.0 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.2 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.0.3 v dplyr 1.0.2 ## v tidyr 1.1.2 v stringr 1.4.0 ## v readr 1.3.1 v forcats 0.5.0 ## -- Conflicts ------------------------------------------------------ tidyverse_conflicts() -- ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(mosaic) ## Loading required package: lattice ## Loading required package: ggformula ## Loading required package: ggstance ## ## Attaching package: 'ggstance' ## The following objects are masked from 'package:ggplot2': ## ## geom_errorbarh, GeomErrorbarh ## ## New to ggformula?

item.title: HR analytics
item.description: For this analysis, I have taken a data set on Human Resrouce Analytics from the IBM HR Analytics Employee Attrition & Performance data set, it is a fictional data set created by IBM data scientists. First We load the libraries for the functions we will need for the analysis. ```r library(tidyverse) #load libraries library(mosaic) library(ggthemes) library(lubridate) library(fivethirtyeight) library(here) library(skimr) library(janitor) library(vroom) library(tidyquant) library(kableExtra) library(broom) library(GGally) library(huxtable) options(scipen=200) #load data from csv hr_dataset <- read_csv(here::here("data", "datasets_1067_1925_WA_Fn-UseC_-HR-Employee-Attrition.

item.title: London bikes analytics
item.description: Lets perform an analysis to get a better understanding of the usage of the London or “Boris” bikes. Has the pandemic impacted the bike usage in 2020? lets find out! First, lets load some libraries that are needed for our analysis. library(tidyverse) # Load ggplot2, dplyr, and all the other tidyverse packages ## -- Attaching packages ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- tidyverse 1.3.0 -- ## v ggplot2 3.3.2 v purrr 0.3.4 ## v tibble 3.

item.title: Hello R Markdown
item.description: R Markdown This is an R Markdown document. Markdown is a simple formatting syntax for authoring HTML, PDF, and MS Word documents. For more details on using R Markdown see http://rmarkdown.rstudio.com.
